# Ruitian Liu

I am a graduate student in the Department of Statistics at the University of California, Davis, where I began my M.S. in Statistics in 2025. Prior to that, I earned my B.S. in Statistics from the North China Institute of Science and Technology in from 2021-2025. 

My academic interests includes high dimensional bayesian inference, functional/longitudinal data analysis, model selection, applications to public policy and psychology.


## Current Work
- Functional data analysis of typhoon intensity & tracks in western north pacific
- Analysis and imputation of missing data under AR(1) setting
- Prior selection for bayesian regression
